pages.title: Logic Sensor
pages.text: A thin wireless sensor that reads data from any $(thing)Create machine$() it's pointed at — speeds, temperatures, fluid levels, inventories, and more. Links to a logistics network via frequency.$(br2)Peripheral type: $(thing)"logicsensor"$()
$(bold)To connect:$() Right-click on any Create linked block (Stock Link, etc.) to join that logistics network. Then right-click a target machine to aim the sensor at it.

pages.title: Lua API
pages.text: $(li)$(thing)isLinked()$() → boolean — connected to network?$(br)$(li)$(thing)getNetworkID()$() → string or nil$(br)$(li)$(thing)getPosition()$() → {x, y, z} — sensor position$(br)$(li)$(thing)getTargetPosition()$() → {x, y, z} — aimed machine position$(br)$(li)$(thing)getData()$() → table — cached target data (refreshes every 1s)$(br)$(li)$(thing)getTargetData()$() → table — force fresh read$(br)$(li)$(thing)refresh()$() — force cache refresh$(br2)The $(thing)getData()$() method returns different fields depending on the target machine type.

pages.title: Data Examples
pages.text: $(bold)Reading machine speed:$()$(br)$(#4488CC)local s = peripheral.find("logicsensor")$(br)local data = s.getData()$(br)print("Speed: " .. data.speed)$(br)print("Stress: " .. data.stress)$()$(br2)$(bold)Supported sources:$()$(br)$(li)Kinetic blocks — speed, stress, capacity$(br)$(li)Blaze burners — heat level, fuel$(br)$(li)Fluid tanks — fluid type, amount$(br)$(li)Inventories — items, slot data$(br)$(li)Train stations — present train$(br)$(li)Signals — signal state$(br)$(li)Track switches — switch position
